intro: Sisyrinchium teres, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Sisyrinchium teres is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments.
